page.title: 08ALL STRETTON VILLAGE
page.content: {ALL STRETTON}is a quiet, peaceful village with a shop that sells every thing including frozen food, meat, vegetables, fruit, household goods and sweets. It is also a post office. There is a nice hotel which is used a lot. The hotel was built in 1838. There is a pub called the Yew Tree Inn. The pub is also old, built in 1720 and the people are friendly. There is a tremendous community spirit in the village. Everyone seems anxious to work together for the good of all. Newcomers are welcomed and quickly belong. There is a Good Neighbour Scheme to help the elderly. The All Stretton Society is concerned with conservation in the area, and The Commoner's Association looks after rights. The All Stretton Records Trust keeps an on-going record of any antiquities in the village.
